qas.question: Who was elected president of the Congo in 1992?
Who supported the measures of liberalisation Lissouba tried to employ to reform the economy?
What interrupted the renewal of the IMF agreement with the Congo?
Who was Congo's last elected president?
What year did the IMF turn down  a three-year SDR69.5m (US$100m) enhanced structural adjustment facility?
When did civil war end in Congo?
Who was president during the period of single party democracy?

context: <a0_0><b4_0><b7_0>Pascal Lissouba<b7_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, who became Congo's first elected president (1992–1997) during the period of multi-party democracy, attempted to implement economic reforms with <a1_0>IMF<a1_0/> backing to liberalise the economy. In June <b5_0>1996<b5_0/> the IMF approved a three-year SDR69.5m (US$100m) <a3_0>enhanced structural adjustment facility<a3_0/> (ESAF) and was on the verge of announcing a renewed annual agreement when <a2_0>civil war<a2_0/> broke out in Congo in <b6_0>mid-1997<b6_0/>.
